intro: Hordeum polystichon var. vulgare, commonly known as wild barley, is a grass species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its slender,丛生 growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences with two to three bracts, typical of the Poaceae family. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides, fields, and waste areas. Wild barley is an important forage plant and has been studied for its potential in sustainable agriculture.
